docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
Short URL (https://bit.ly/sops) to this page:

public URL: https://godwinlab.github.io/sops/

Symbol Meaning window or application menu right/left right/left click with a mouse timer || logical OR && logical AND

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Check
    • Tune on (clockwise) the gas regulators on the wall: Ar = 80–110, N2 = 0–10
    • Chiller: water level
  2. Change or install nebuliser
  3. Check autosampler: horizontal (check by going to Home and then Wash) & vertical position
  4. Aridus
    1. drain Peripump
    2. Go to MQ or 2% HNO3
    3. Power on
    4. AridusLink: Spray Chamber 110°C, Desolvator 140°C. ~30 mins
    5. Purge the system with Ar Sweep Gas 3.0 L/min (N2 addition Gas 10 mL/min) for 5 mins
  5. Change cones
    • sample cone: wet || dry
    • skimmer cone:
      • Mo, Zn, Ni, Ba: HS1-7 Ni 58653
  6. Digital–tab Extras, turn on:
    • Peripump
    • Chiller Switch
      • Check chiller Water Flow in the monitor panel in the bottom-right of the screen: >2 L/min
  7. Ignite the plasma
    1. Aridus Ar = 0.5, N2 = 0
    2. Plasma Control–green button START: right, left. Peltier should be off when using Aridus (“dry”). After ignition:
    3. Check chiller Water Flow: normally >1, at least >0.9
    4. If HV2 error: Protection–ResetTrips
    5. slowly increase Aridus Ar to ~3 L/min (N2 = 0)
  8. Tune
    1. Autosampler Control: go to tune solution
    2. Setup–Tunning–Download–All, load from a .TUN file
    3. Set Magnet
      1. Upper right corner, choose configuration for Collector ID assignment
      2. Monitor chart in monitor panel: double click to choose Collector IDs/Masses
      3. Scan–Magnet Scans, in Magnet Scans:
        1. Set a range around the mass@Ax
        2. Stop
        3. Move dash line to the peak center (drag with right button of the mouse)
        4. Control–Set Magnet
    4. Tune Aridus for high sensitivity
    5. Tune plasma for high sensitivity in Plasma Control
      1. ?? Coolant
      2. Aux
        • dry cone: 1
      3. Neb(Press.)
        • 27 or 31 ??
        • affect stability, better to be tuned like Aridus Ar
      4. up/down
      5. Obs In/Out: <8
      6. Back/Fwd
    6. Deflector–tab Source, tune for high sensitivity (Refer to Setup–Tuning–Edit Autotune Sequences. Saved in C:\Nu Plasma Files\Instrument Settings\Deflect.dat)
      • Fixed: HV1 6000, HV4 1875
      • HV 2,3,5,6
        • HV2 always > 2200
      • Tune Source V1 & V2 together, Tune Source H1 & H2 together
      • Transfer DL
      • Transfer H1
      • Transfer V1, V2
      • HV 2,3
    7. Deflector–tab Quad, tune for peak shape (resolution) and alignment
      • in Magnet Scans:
        • Set a range around the mass@Ax
        • View– Auto-Scale
      • Linked Quads (tune alignment when maintaining shape)
      • Quad 1 peak shape
      • Quad 2 peak alignment
      • Q15 Corr for low mass, Q16 Corr for high mass. Affect both peak shape and alignment
      • ??Lin L/H/Corr
      • ??Cubic
      • Auto
        1. choose 2 cups
        2. Enough range: Start/End Scan
        3. Magnet Scans, Control–Optimize Quad Coincidence
      • Quantification of peak alignment by Monitor–Peak Parallelism, in Peak Parallelism Utility:
        • …??
      • Check resolution for a single ion beam: View–Show peak info
    8. Tune Aridus Ar for optimising stability (may sacrifice sensitivity)
      1. Step increase sweep gas by 0.03
      2. Setup–Preferences–Analysis: tick “User may set analysis mass (eg from mass scan)”
      3. Data Acquisition–Single Run–Isotopic: XxOpt.nrf, 10 runs, peak center for the first run, no peak center after that. After the first run:
        1. Note down Magnet set point: XXX amu in monitor panel, but it is best to confirm the value in a Results file: Axial Masses used: XXX
        2. Scan–Magnet Scans: manually set the magnet at this exact mass position
          • “drag” the cursor using the right mouse button, and Control–Set Magnet
      4. Record in Xx Sweep gas optimisation template.xlsx, and find a plateau
  9. Faraday Noise
    1. close analyser valve, wait for 5 mins
    2. Monitor–Faraday Noise
    3. ?? tick 5 sec integration
    4. SD < 2e-5
  10. Gain
    1. close analyser valve, wait for 5 mins
    2. Calibration–Preamp Gain
      1. Num of cycles: 2, Calibration Volt. (V): 40
      2. Check
        • ?? Gain
        • ?? Error (‰?) should be less than 10
      3. Run & Save Results
  11. Data Acquisition–Batch Run–Setup
    • File–Open, Select Auto Sequence .arf file
    • Options (saved in .Opt file)
      • tab Sequence Settings, test and set Transfer Time (secs)
      • tab Analysis Options
        • untick: Peak Centre during analysis
        • Shut down after run? can be changed during batch run: Set Up–Preferences–Shut down at end of analysis
        • On completion move autosampler to: Wash 1 || a position of Wash/Blank with enough solution left (e.g., with a 50 µl/min nebuliser, 10 ml will drain in 200 mins)
  12. Shutdown
    1. after the sequence is finished, go to MQ or 2% HNO3 for >10 mins
    2. Plasma Control–red button STOP. Wait
    3. Digital–tab Extras: Chiller (Peripump is turned off automatically)
    4. Aridus power off (? if Aridus cannot be power off soon, remotely set Aridus: Spray 30°C, Desolvator 80°C)
    5. Tubing: drain for Aridus, …
    6. Change nebuliser?
    7. Autosampler power off
    8. Tune off (anti-clockwise) the gas regulators on the wall (Ar, N2)
    9. Remove your belongings from the MC-ICP-MS lab

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Check
    • Tune on (clockwise) the gas regulators on the wall: Ar = 80–110, N2 = 0–10
    • Chiller: water level
  2. Change or install nebuliser
  3. Check autosampler: horizontal (check by going to Home and then Wash) & vertical position
  4. Aridus
    1. drain Peripump
    2. Go to MQ or 2% HNO3
    3. Power on
    4. AridusLink: Spray Chamber 110°C, Desolvator 140°C. ~30 mins
    5. Purge the system with Ar Sweep Gas 3.0 L/min (N2 addition Gas 10 mL/min) for 5 mins
  5. Change cones
    • sample cone: wet || dry
    • skimmer cone:
      • Mo, Zn, Ni, Ba: HS1-7 Ni 58653
  6. Digital–tab Extras, turn on:
    • Peripump
    • Chiller Switch
      • Check chiller Water Flow in the monitor panel in the bottom-right of the screen: >2 L/min
  7. Ignite the plasma
    1. Aridus Ar = 0.5, N2 = 0
    2. Plasma Control–green button START: right, left. Peltier should be off when using Aridus (“dry”). After ignition:
    3. Check chiller Water Flow: normally >1, at least >0.9
    4. If HV2 error: Protection–ResetTrips
    5. slowly increase Aridus Ar to ~3 L/min (N2 = 0)
  8. Tune
    1. Autosampler Control: go to tune solution
    2. Setup–Tunning–Download–All, load from a .TUN file
    3. Set Magnet
      1. Upper right corner, choose configuration for Collector ID assignment
      2. Monitor chart in monitor panel: double click to choose Collector IDs/Masses
      3. Scan–Magnet Scans, in Magnet Scans:
        1. Set a range around the mass@Ax
        2. Stop
        3. Move dash line to the peak center (drag with right button of the mouse)
        4. Control–Set Magnet
    4. Tune Aridus for high sensitivity
    5. Tune plasma for high sensitivity in Plasma Control
      1. ?? Coolant
      2. Aux
        • dry cone: 1
      3. Neb(Press.)
        • 27 or 31 ??
        • affect stability, better to be tuned like Aridus Ar
      4. up/down
      5. Obs In/Out: <8
      6. Back/Fwd
    6. Deflector–tab Source, tune for high sensitivity (Refer to Setup–Tuning–Edit Autotune Sequences. Saved in C:\Nu Plasma Files\Instrument Settings\Deflect.dat)
      • Fixed: HV1 6000, HV4 1875
      • HV 2,3,5,6
        • HV2 always > 2200
      • Tune Source V1 & V2 together, Tune Source H1 & H2 together
      • Transfer DL
      • Transfer H1
      • Transfer V1, V2
      • HV 2,3
    7. Deflector–tab Quad, tune for peak shape (resolution) and alignment
      • in Magnet Scans:
        • Set a range around the mass@Ax
        • View– Auto-Scale
      • Linked Quads (tune alignment when maintaining shape)
      • Quad 1 peak shape
      • Quad 2 peak alignment
      • Q15 Corr for low mass, Q16 Corr for high mass. Affect both peak shape and alignment
      • ??Lin L/H/Corr
      • ??Cubic
      • Auto
        1. choose 2 cups
        2. Enough range: Start/End Scan
        3. Magnet Scans, Control–Optimize Quad Coincidence
      • Quantification of peak alignment by Monitor–Peak Parallelism, in Peak Parallelism Utility:
        • …??
      • Check resolution for a single ion beam: View–Show peak info
    8. Tune Aridus Ar for optimising stability (may sacrifice sensitivity)
      1. Step increase sweep gas by 0.03
      2. Setup–Preferences–Analysis: tick “User may set analysis mass (eg from mass scan)”
      3. Data Acquisition–Single Run–Isotopic: XxOpt.nrf, 10 runs, peak center for the first run, no peak center after that. After the first run:
        1. Note down Magnet set point: XXX amu in monitor panel, but it is best to confirm the value in a Results file: Axial Masses used: XXX
        2. Scan–Magnet Scans: manually set the magnet at this exact mass position
          • “drag” the cursor using the right mouse button, and Control–Set Magnet
      4. Record in Xx Sweep gas optimisation template.xlsx, and find a plateau
  9. Faraday Noise
    1. close analyser valve, wait for 5 mins
    2. Monitor–Faraday Noise
    3. ?? tick 5 sec integration
    4. SD < 2e-5
  10. Gain
    1. close analyser valve, wait for 5 mins
    2. Calibration–Preamp Gain
      1. Num of cycles: 2, Calibration Volt. (V): 40
      2. Check
        • ?? Gain
        • ?? Error (‰?) should be less than 10
      3. Run & Save Results
  11. Data Acquisition–Batch Run–Setup
    • File–Open, Select Auto Sequence .arf file
    • Options (saved in .Opt file)
      • tab Sequence Settings, test and set Transfer Time (secs)
      • tab Analysis Options
        • untick: Peak Centre during analysis
        • Shut down after run? can be changed during batch run: Set Up–Preferences–Shut down at end of analysis
        • On completion move autosampler to: Wash 1 || a position of Wash/Blank with enough solution left (e.g., with a 50 µl/min nebuliser, 10 ml will drain in 200 mins)
  12. Shutdown
    1. after the sequence is finished, go to MQ or 2% HNO3 for >10 mins
    2. Plasma Control–red button STOP. Wait
    3. Digital–tab Extras: Chiller (Peripump is turned off automatically)
    4. Aridus power off (? if Aridus cannot be power off soon, remotely set Aridus: Spray 30°C, Desolvator 80°C)
    5. Tubing: drain for Aridus, …
    6. Change nebuliser?
    7. Autosampler power off
    8. Tune off (anti-clockwise) the gas regulators on the wall (Ar, N2)
    9. Remove your belongings from the MC-ICP-MS lab

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Flush sample needle with He gas
    1. Prep–Move Gilson to next vial. If Gilson does not move: Prep–Initialise Gilson, then try again.
    2. AB, MH
    3. Check: AD
    4. AE
    5. Connect He gas
    6. Wipe off acid
    7. Check flow rate through the needle
    8. Disonnect He gas

  2. Pump out

    1. Put on an old vial on needle
    2. ML, AD, until ML vac ≈ 1e-3
    3. Prep–Initialise Gilson

  3. Remove old vial

  4. AB, ML
  5. MH (auto ML)
  6. Change old sample vials in the heater block into new sample vials
  7. Replenish reference gas
    1. LV, RP, RV
    2. Set bellow to 1400
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually open lower valve on reference gas cylinder: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
    8. Manually close lower valve on reference gas cylinder, manually open upper valve on reference gas cylinder: release reference gas 30s
    9. LV
    10. Manually close upper valve on reference gas cylinder, manually open lower valve on reference gas cylinder, replenish reference gas 30s
    11. Manually close lower valve on reference gas cylinder
    12. RI, RP
    13. Set bellow to 0, until bellow fully open
    14. RM
    15. Check 44 ≈ 2.5e-9
  8. Test–Peak center
  9. Close scan

  10. Update sample table in the batch

    1. Analysis–Autorun batch edit–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. MPRPCM: Setup
    3. Release all
    4. Enter new sample numbers, then OK–OK

  11. Reboot by Ctrl+Alt+Del

  12. Fill liquid N2 dewar (20L)
  13. Check two tubes: ~2 cm from the end of the wood stick
  14. Check connect pipes
  15. Run the bacth
    1. Analysis–Autorun start/stop–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. Run

docs.title: Version History
docs.text: • 2024-01-11: Based on notes by James Rolfe
